intro: Acinodendron neurocarpum, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, orange-colored fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
